critique: This document is an executive order that amends a previous executive order (No. 10853) regarding allowances for government personnel on foreign duty, specifically referencing sections of Title 38 of the United States Code related to veterans' benefits. It delegates authority to the Secretary of State to prescribe rules and regulations related to these allowances. Given the subject matter, the document has limited implications for ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion. The primary focus is on administrative procedure and delegation of authority within the executive branch.
